custom_fields.key_topics: This course introduces students to the foundation of IS, Strategy and Organization, Strategic Use of Information Resource in a Global Economy, Organisational Strategies: Managerial Levers Work Design: Enabling Global Collaboration, Cultural theories and IT adoption theories.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Junior and Senior students are suitable for enrolment.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assessments in the course typically include a major research reports, case analysis, presentation, field studies.
custom_fields.goals: Evaluate the global drivers behind digital transformation and their effect on society and organizations. Identify the importance of aligning IS strategy with organizational objectives and the importance of IS assets in supporting organizational success. Identify factors involved in technology adoption and diffusion in different social, cultures and organizational environments. Analyze current and future technological trends and their implications on organizational direction for decisionmaking. Analyze the key strategic issues facing management in deploying digital and IS strategies. Formulate and recommend appropriate IS strategies to fit sociocultural and sociotechnical contexts and requirement.
custom_fields.relevance: This course is relevant to all IS students. It provides possible career paths in IT consultant and management consultant.
custom_fields.learning_resources: The course has a combination of online materials consisting of scholarly articles, government publications, and industry reports, as well as a relevant textbook.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: This is a 9 units course. On average, a student is expected to spend 9 hours a week on this course, consisting of 3 hours in class and 6 hours of self-study.

long_desc: Our world is being transformed with a digital revolution spanning across all aspects of society, culture, and organizations. This transformation has provided many with the opportunity to innovate and prosper, while others have struggled to keep up and have eventually perished. What does it take to be successful in the digital revolution How can we harness the potential of Information Systems to compete and prosper as organizations and communities The aim of this course is to prepare students to be effective digital transformation strategists. Given the global aspects of the digital revolution, the course adopts a global perspective, where students explore multidimensional aspects of IS management, incorporating strategic leadership, cross cultural management and technology adoption and diffusion in different contexts. This course provides an understanding of IS enabled change in the business environment the alignment between IS strategies and business objectives and ways in which business could leverage IS to transform and create digital strategies for a sustained competitive advantage. Students will also be exposed to digital ecosystems in various industries and across cultural platforms.
name: Digital Transformation, Strategy and Management
